data.title: The Mighty Team
data.meta_description: The Mighty Team that helps make our Mighty Kids Mighty.
data.text:
Tim Whitaker

Executive Director

TIM WHITAKER began his career teaching fifth and sixth grade in Philadelphia before becoming a writer and editor. He was the editor of Philadelphia Weekly (1994-2008), and previously the editor of PhillySport and Pittsburgh magazines. Whitaker was a head writer at NBC Radio and has written for PBS, The New York Times, Washington Post and Philadelphia Inquirer. He was the executive producer of an award-winning audio documentary on the history of soul radio in Philadelphia and the author of the book “Crash: The Life and Times of Dick Allen.”

Email: twhitaker@mightywriters.org

Rekyiah Abdul-Zahir

Director of Human Resources

REKYIAH ABDUL-ZAHIR, a Durham, North Carolina, native, has a bachelor's degree in finance from North Carolina A&T State University and a master’s in Human Resources administration from Central Michigan University. She's worked in the field of nonprofit humans resources for over 18 years.

razahir@mightywriters.org

maureen boland

Senior Writer

MAUREEN BOLAND is a National Board Certified English teacher who has taught in New York City schools, Roberto Clemente Middle School and Parkway Center City Middle College in Philadelphia. A recipient of the Lindback Award for teaching, Maureen teaches writing to bilingual students at La Salle.

mboland@mightywriters.org

Kiarah Cannady

Family Engagement Coordinator

KIARAH CANNADY, a Philly native and Mighty Writers alum, understands firsthand the importance of organizations like MW. She began her professional journey as a youth ambassador with PYN and most recently worked with the Anderson Monarchs, serving as an advocate for Philadelphia youth and their families.

kcannady@mightywriters.org

Austin M. Clarkson

Director of Business Development

AUSTIN CLARKSON, a Philly native, has a bachelor's degree in business management from Howard University. Prior to Mighty Writers, Austin worked in community outreach for Chosen 300 Ministries and Norristown Rising and participated in volunteer initiatives with the Allstate Foundation.

aclarkson@mightywriters.org

Kaloni Davis

Multimedia Producer

KALONI DAVIS, a Philadelphia native, studied theater at the Creative and Performing Arts High School and graduated from Temple's film program. He's directed multiple music videos for local recording artists and has produced two independent films of his own. He also published a graphic novel. kdavis@mightywriters.org

Christina Echevarria

Volunteer Manager

CHRISTINA ECHEVARRIA, an Allentown native, got her bachelor's degree in education from Regent University. She has worked with students for over 20 years, from serving as a high school caseworker to coaching college basketball.

cechevarria@mightywriters.org

JULIE GILBERT

Human Resources Manager

JULIE GILBERT has a bachelor's degree in elementary and early childhood education from Kutztown University. Before joining MW, she worked for nine years in the nonprofit sector, handling personnel management, recruitment, training, employee relations and building a supportive and inclusive work culture. jgilbert@mightywriters.org

Molly Hampson

Development Associate, Chester County

MOLLY HAMPSON is a graduate of Ursinus College with a bachelor's degree focused in media and communications. She has over 10 years of experience in the nonprofit organization management industry.

mhampson@mightywriters.org

Troi Hinson

Mentorship Manager

TROI HINSON, a South Jersey native, has a bachelor’s degree in digital studies and gender studies from Rutgers University-Camden after transferring in from Montclair State. She is the director of football operations and the main photographer for Camden High School’s football team.

thinson@mightywriters.org

Kelly Lasserre

Director of Design

KELLY LASSERRE, a Mississippi native who grew up in coastal Massachusetts, has a bachelor's degree from the Maryland Institute College of Art. Prior to coming to Mighty Writers, Kelly worked as a freelance artist and illustrator, creating work for books, magazines, design studios and client commissions.

Email: klasserre@mightywriters.org

Naomi Levecchia

Director of Development

Naomi Levecchia joined MW in 2016 after working as an attorney and as a fundraiser for various arts and social service organizations in New Jersey. She holds degrees from Rutgers Camden School of Law, the University of North Texas, and the Eastman School of Music in french horn performance and ethnomusicology. nlevecchia@mightywriters.org

Rachel Loeper

Director of Operations and Impact

RACHEL LOEPER, MW's first program director (2009-’14) and education director (2014-’21), has a bachelor's in English from Goucher College and an MFA in creative writing from Hollins University. She has published and presented widely on the themes of inspiring reluctant writers and improving educational access for underserved communities. Email: rloeper@mightywriters.org

Kaitlyn McCarthy-Quiñones

Director of Social & Emotional Learning

KAITLYN MCCARTHY, a Philadelphia native, has a bachelor's degree in education from Temple University. Prior to Mighty Writers, Kate taught English in Philadelphia schools for several years, including at Kensington CAPA, Boys' Latin Charter and Central High School. kmccarthy@mightywriters.org

Emily Montgomery

Social Media Manager

EMILY MONTGOMERY, a Philly-area native, has a bachelor's in communications from Stockton University. Emily has been a journalist since college, when she worked as a reporter for The Press of Atlantic City. She then moved on to become a content creator for FOX 29 News. Previously, Emily facilitated a teen writing fellowship at MW AC. Email: emontgomery@mightywriters.org

Katie Rogers

Strategic Assistant to the Executive Director

KATIE ROGERS, is a graduate of Temple University's creative writing program, where she worked at the Writing Center tutoring both ELL and native English speakers. Throughout the pandemic, she worked as a private tutor to support students struggling with online learning. Katie is the writer/reporter of Mighty Voices. krogers@mightywriters.org

Mohammad Sadiq Sadeed

Finance Manager

MOHAMMAD SADIQ SADEED has a BA from American University of Afghanistan and an MBA from the University of South Wales. Prior to joining Mighty Writers, Mohammad worked with HIAS PA as an office manager and finance associate. Before moving the to U.S. in 2019, he worked with U.S. embassies, the UN, the Netherlands Embassy and other NGOs for 18+ years. mssadeed@mightywriters.org

Sukripa Shah

Grants Manager

SUKRIPA SHAH, originally from Kathmandu, Nepal, came to the U.S. to in 2018 for her master's degree at Villanova. Sukripa is a storyteller dedicated to working with mission-driven organizations that impact the lives of children and youth.

sshah@mightywriters.org

Liz Spikol

Director of Communications

LIZ SPIKOL, a Philly native, has a bachelor's in creative writing from Oberlin College and a master's in translation studies from UT Austin. She worked for more than 20 years as a writer/editor, including as editorial director of Mid-Atlantic Media and real estate editor of Philly mag. Her work has been featured in the NY Times, BBC, Huff Post and more. lspikol@mightywriters.org

Shari young

Finance Director

SHARI YOUNG, a New York native, grew up on the south shore of Long Island. After spending a year in Europe during high school, she received a bachelor's degree in French and international studies from Penn State and a master's in art business from Sotheby’s Institute. Shari has been working in business and nonprofit finance and administration for more than 10 years. syoung@mightywriters.org

Programming

MARY AIKEN

Senior Literacy Director

MARY AIKEN got her bachelor's in political science from Temple, her master's in elementary education from Drexel and a school administration certificate from Penn. She was a fifth-grade teacher in the Cheltenham School District for 12 years, then became a Gifted teacher. She is the founder of an African American girls' leadership group (P.R.I.D.E.) and was named a Pulitzer Center Fellow for 2022-’23. maiken@mightywriters.org

GRACE BERNICKER

Director of Partnership Programs

GRACE BERNICKER, a Philadelphia native, has a bachelor's degree in communications from Temple University. A singer-songwriter who runs her own label, Grace teaches the Mighty Girls Rock and Mighty Music Makers workshops, and runs initiatives such as On the Road and PlayStreets, partnering with like-minded organizations in the communities we serve.

gbernicker@mightywriters.org

AMEERA BULLOCK

Literacy Manager, Camden

AMEERA BULLOCK, an educator in Camden for 10 years, got her bachelor's and master's degrees from Rowan University. The owner of The Love Co. LLC, which teaches healing and growth through literacy, expression and art, Ameera has taught many workshops at MW, including Girl Power Game Room, Girl Power Artist and Mighty Toddler STEMLab. abullock@mightywriters.org

Bryana Crump

Literacy Director, Germantown

BRYANA CRUMP, a Philly native, got her bachelor's in communications from Lincoln University of PA and has more than seven years of experience helping children improve their reading and writing skills. At Wieden + Kennedy, Bryana honed her marketing and creative storytelling skills. She also coordinated educational programs for a prominent local art institution. bcrump@mightywriters.org

Sara Dickens-Trillo

Senior Director, El Paso

SARA DICKENS-TRILLO is the founding leader of MW El Futuro Kennett in Chester County, where she served as VP of the Mexican culture nonprofit Casa Guanajuato and as a board member of La Communidad, a health center network. In 2023, Sara moved back to her family home of El Paso, where she is bringing MW programs to Texan youth through work with 21st Century Learning programs and Deanna Davenport Elementary School. sdtrillo@ mightywriters.org.

Derrick Gallashaw

Senior Director, Camden

DERRICK GALLASHAW, a Camden, New Jersey, native, has a bachelor's in business finance & economics from William Paterson University and a master’s in higher ed administration from Rowan. He has nearly 20 years of experience in educational advancement of inner-city youth, including as assistant director of precollege programs for GEAR UP at Rowan. dgallashaw@mightywriters.org

Yakquelin Garduño

Senior Director, Kennett

YAKQUELIN GARDUÑO was born in Mexico and moved to the United States at 6 months of age. She grew up in Kennett Square and Jennersville and got her bachelor's degree in English and communications from Immaculata University. Prior to coming to Mighty Writers, she worked with students as a college writing tutor and an ESL aide. ygarduno@mightywriters.org

Danielle Jackson

Literacy Manager, Camden

DANIELLE JACKSON, a Camden native, is a longtime literacy advocate. Through her well-known Hoodbrarian initiative, which has been featured in numerous media outlets, Danielle implements literacy programs and distribution efforts in Camden, promoting a love of reading in kids and ensuring the availability of community resources.

djackson@mightywriters.org

Regine Jean-Louis

Literacy Manager, Newark

REGINE JEAN-LOUIS, a native of Haiti, has a bachelor’s degree in psychology with a minor in religious studies. She is currently working on a master's degree in organizational leadership with an emphasis on grit and resilience. Prior to working at Mighty Writers, Regine worked in academia and the banking industry for more than 20 years. rjeanlouis@mightywriters.org

Daniela Morales

Literacy Manager, El Futuro

DANIELA MORALES was born in Mexico and raised in Philadelphia. A DACA recipient, Daniela is working on her associate’s degree in psychology and education at Community College of Philadelphia. A first-generation college student and the first to graduate high school in her family, Daniela has worked with children of all ages at Bright Horizons University City and helped with marketing at her family business, Taqueria Morales. dmorales@mightywriters.org

NYOKA MYERS

Literacy Director, Newark

NYOKA MYERS, a New York native, has a bachelor's degree in arts administration and Spanish from Albright College. She performed spoken word throughout high school. As a youth behavioral assistant, Nyoka taught the importance of literacy, emotional intelligence and self-acceptance. Prior to serving as Newark's Literacy Director, she was a Newark Literacy Manager.

nmyers@mightywriters.org

ANGIE BRU PALACIO

Literacy Manager, El Futuro

ANGIE BRU PALACIO came to the U.S. from Colombia when she was 19 and got a bachelor's degree in social work from La Salle University. Prior to joining Mighty Writers, she was a resource parent support worker for foster care children and families and a behavioral health technician providing one-on-one services to schoolchildren.

apalacio@mightywriters.org

CLAUDIA PEREGRINA

Senior Director, El Futuro

CLAUDIA PEREGRINA, a Mexico City native, has degrees in contemporary art and psychology from La Universidad de las Bellas Artes and La Universidad Autónoma de México. She got a Leeway Foundation Art & Change Grant and the Leeway Transformation Award and was named one of 10 Latinos with significant achievements by the Philadelphia Inquirer.

cperegrina@mightywriters.org

KATHLEEN RIZZO

Literacy Director, Atlantic City

KATHY RIZZO, an Atlantic City, New Jersey, native, has a bachelor's degree in health sciences from Stockton University. She previously worked with Cultural Homestay International and Covenant House Atlantic City. She also spent 25 years working in every aspect of the hospitality industry.

krizzo@mightywriters.org

TOM SYKES

Senior Director, Atlantic City

TOM SYKES, an Atlantic City, New Jersey, native, has a BFA in screenwriting from New York University Tisch School of the Arts. Prior to Mighty Writers, Tom lived in Los Angeles where he worked in film/TV and as a ghostwriter for diverse talent. He continues projects on both coasts and has written cover stories for The Press of Atlantic City.

tsykes@mightywriters.org

Shawn Thomas

Literacy Manager, Kennett

SHAWN THOMAS was born in Coatesville and grew up in Lancaster, PA. He graduated from the University of Delaware with a bachelor of arts degree in public policy. At the university, Shawn worked as a resident assistant with residence life and housing and a building manager for the Wellbeing Center on campus.

sthomas@mightywriters.org

Synae Williams

Literacy Director, North

SYNAE WILLIAMS, a Philadelphia native, attended North Carolina A&T and studied elementary education. She worked as a teacher in the Philadelphia school district for eight years and with Philadelphia Freedom school, a youth-serving organization that focuses on reading. She also worked for Camp Jill Scott for 13 years.

swilliams@mightywriters.org

Operations

Andre Blakney

Distribution Operations Manager, Camden

ANDRE BLAKNEY attended Camden High and played for Centenary College on a basketball scholarship. Prior to coming to Mighty Writers, Andre worked as a mentor and tutor at the YMCA, and constructed landmark buildings across Camden as part of a carpenters' union.

ablakney@mightywriters.org

Desmond Dozier

Director of Distribution

DESMOND DOZIER was born on a military base in Newport, Rhode Island. As a Navy baby, his family moved around until they eventually landed in the Philadelphia suburbs. He has a bachelor's degree in political science from George Washington University and a career of organizing and outreach.

ddozier@mightywriters.org

Mairany Hernández

Distribution Operations Manager, El Futuro Kennett

Mathieu Kanunde

Distribution Coordinator, North

MATHIEU KANUNDE was born in Lusaka, Zambia, and came to the U.S. at 13. He grew up across the country but now calls Philadelphia his second home. Mathieu attended CCP for his associate's degree in psychology. Prior to Mighty Writers, he worked in the restaurant industry and for Goodyear.

mkanunde@mightywriters.org

Omar Navarette

Distribution Coordinator, Atlantic City

Ryan Palmer

Distribution Manager, West

RYAN PALMER has worked with many organizations that focus on bettering the city of Philadelphia and its various communities. At 13 years of age, he won volunteer of the year for the Freedom Valley YMCA. In 2013, he was the first ever recipient of the Philadelphia 76ers' Heroes Among Us Award. rpalmer@mightywriters.org

MALIK VINCENT

Distribution Manager

MALIK VINCENT was born and raised in Philadelphia. Prior to joining Mighty Writers, he worked as an outbound manager with United Parcel Service. He is currently pursuing a private pilot certificate.

mvincent@mightywriters. org

Would you like to work with us? Find out more.

Mighty Writers is a class 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization established in 2009. All of our programs are free. We serve communities in and around Philadelphia, PA; in Camden, Newark and Atlantic City, NJ; and in El Paso, Texas.

Stay connected!
